intro: Czeikia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to Central and Eastern Europe, particularly found in regions like Poland, Ukraine, and the Czech Republic. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are bell-shaped, usually blue or violet, and bloom in late summer. Czeikia species are often characterized by their slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves.
